summary: This is an email from Judge Nathan's chambers to attorneys Jeff Pa liuca and Laura Mennin er, transmitting a Daubert opinion and order in the case United States v. Maxwell (20cr330). The opinion was issued on November 11, 2021, and was scheduled to be docketed the following day.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Issued the Daubert opinion and order in the case United States v. Maxwell. The email is from her chambers.

persons.name: Jeff Pa liuca
persons.context: Recipient of the email transmitting the court's opinion and order in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Mennin er
persons.context: Recipient of the email transmitting the court's opinion and order in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge whose chambers sent the email. She is the judge presiding over the case United States v. Maxwell.

connections.description: Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a court order to attorney Jeff Pa liuca, indicating a judge-attorney relationship in the ongoing case.
Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a court order to attorney Laura Mennin er, indicating a judge-attorney relationship in the ongoing case.

events.title: Daubert Opinion Issued in Maxwell Case
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an opinion and order regarding Daubert motions in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20cr330).

keyFacts: The document is an email transmitting a court opinion from Judge Nathan's chambers to counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case (20cr330).
The opinion is a Daubert ruling, which pertains to the admissibility of expert witness testimony.
The opinion was issued on November 11, 2021, and was to be formally docketed on November 12, 2021.
The case referenced is United States v. Maxwell, indicating ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.
